bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 8, 1904

div1.p: Carter discusses financial matters, as well as issues regarding the local authorities.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 8, 1904
div1.opener:
Rear Admiral JOHN G. WALKER,
United States Navy, CHAIRMAN,
Major General GEORGE W. DAVIS,
United States Army.
WILLIAM BARCLAY PARSONS, C. E.
WILLIAM H. BURR, C. E.
BENJAMIN M. HARROD, C. E.
C. EWALD GRUNSKY, C. E.
MR. FRANK J. HECKER
ISTHMIAN CANAL COMMISSION.
??? C. Z
Sept 8/04 Night & pretty late too
My dear Daughter:
div1.p:
Well my salary is raised from the
3d inst by $250 so you see the $10352 is
more than covered. I get now $6000 & quarters.
It is worth more than that though to have to do with
Gen'l Davis. I care more for the compliment
than for the money - as I made no request for
any increase, & while Dr G. did make such a re-
quest Mr Grensky says that the increase had
already been made - unanimously by the Commission.
before I am going to write to Col Murray in
N. O. to see if he can get anything from the
Spanish Transatlantic Line - I think not but he
may. The increase if we can get rates on the Plant
steamers - will half pay our trip here-

I did not cable last Saturday because I do not
wish to abuse a favor. You should have rec'd a
letter from me, telling you about the courtesy
of the Cable Co. before sunday the 28th of Aug. when
your letter or rather your mother's was written. A
letter sent by N. O. as this one will be
C1
B20
The commission has done the Sanitary Depart,
no good. & I am entirely sorry. Gen'l Davis beat
them as far as we are concerned. The Engineers are out from under him & he
is not pleased & I think we will not be either. I would
give double my $250 if they had done better
differently. Well I purpose to do the best
work I can do with the means at my disposal
& under the conditions that exist. And I do
not regret coming.

This is a short letter my dear but it is night & it
must go off tomorrow morning & I have had to
write a longer one to Gorgas. I am very well
today & have been pretty well for some time
back & I am taking care of myself.

Dear love to all Sunday I will hear from you all,
by Cable. Please tell Dr W. that the Cable - “Marine
Hospital” is to the Carters & to put that way to
save words, because it is free-
div1.closer:
Your loving father H. R. Carter Tell Ned. the address is
“Ancon
Canal Zone
Isthmus of Panama”
